page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This area is split by the main A264 road running east from Tunbridge Wells to East Grinstead.On one side of this is the mainly residential village of Langton Green.Many of the inhabitants commute daily to work in London.There is also the smaller settlement of Fordcombe,a typical Kentish village on the lip of the Medway Valley. The predominent land use is of mixed farming: cereal crops, hay, pastoral farming and fruit growing. The landscape is gently undulating, dotted with small areas of woodland. There are three large manors, which used to own most of the surrounding land.There is also the very popular climbing area of High Rocks, in the South Eastern corner of the 4x3km block.
